comments:
I got following exception in 3.1 M7. My code is working fine with M6

I have checked the code of FillLayout and found that problem is there on line no
141. It is assumed that lauout of the child control is FillLayout. (In my case
it is GridLayout.)

java.lang.ClassCastException
	at org.eclipse.swt.layout.FillLayout.computeChildSize(FillLayout.java:141)
	at org.eclipse.swt.layout.FillLayout.computeSize(FillLayout.java:119)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite.computeSize(Composite.java:213)
	at org.eclipse.swt.custom.StackLayout.computeSize(StackLayout.java:93)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite.computeSize(Composite.java:213)
	at org.eclipse.swt.layout.GridData.computeSize(GridData.java:463)
	at org.eclipse.swt.layout.GridLayout.layout(GridLayout.java:207)
	at org.eclipse.swt.layout.GridLayout.layout(GridLayout.java:186)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite.updateLayout(Composite.java:869)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite.layout(Composite.java:493)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite.layout(Composite.java:458)


Regards,
Sudhan.

This is not an SWT bug.  There is an error in your code.  You have assigned 
GridData to a child but the parent has a FillLayout.  Please fix your code.

Oppss ...I should have checked twice before posting. Sorry for posting in haste.
Thing was that the code was working since 2.1.3 and started giving ClassCast
only in 3.1 M7.
Sorry for wasting your time.

Thanks,
-Sudhan.
